item.title: 瑞穗考虑推出新举措，瞄准印度私募股权投资热潮
item.description: 瑞穗金融集团（Mizuho Financial Group Inc.【原文：Mizuho Financial Group Inc. is considering making a push into a new area for the lender in India focusing on private equity and venture capital firms, seeking to tap some of the most prolific dealmakers in the country.】

item.title: 丝绸称新西兰央行利率轨迹暗示 2 月后放缓宽松步伐
item.description: 新西兰央行行长助理卡伦-希尔克（Karen Silk）表示，新西兰央行的最新预测表明，在2月份连续第三次降息半个百分点后，央行将放缓宽松步伐，并可能将暂停纳入宽松周期。【原文：The New Zealand central bank’s latest projections imply it will slow the pace of easing and likely incorporate pauses into the cycle after a third straight half-percentage point cut in February, Assistant Governor Karen Silk said.】

item.title: 惠誉评级称中国房地产市场低迷可能延续至 2025 年
item.description: 惠誉国际评级公司（Fitch Ratings）称，尽管政府采取了刺激措施来刺激需求，但由于价格和销售依然疲软，中国长达数年的房地产危机将在 2025 年持续下去。【原文：China’s multiyear property crisis is set to drag on in 2025 as prices and sales remain weak despite the government’s stimulus push to spur demand, according to Fitch Ratings.】

item.title: 特朗普发出关税威胁后，加拿大总理敦促特鲁多加强边境安全
item.description: 加拿大各省省长正敦促总理贾斯汀-特鲁多加强边境安全和国防开支，以消除美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的担忧，加拿大最大省份的领导人称联邦政府 "反应迟缓"、"步履维艰"。【原文：Canada’s premiers are urging Prime Minister Justin Trudeau to step up border security and defense spending to assuage US President-elect Donald Trump’s concerns, with the leader of the largest province calling the federal government “slow to react” and “stuck on its back foot.”】

item.title: 日本 "管理之神 "复活成为人工智能模型
item.description: 松下控股公司（Panasonic Holdings Corp.）周三宣布，该公司根据已故创始人松下幸之助的著作、演讲和 3,000 多条语音记录，创建了一个人工智能克隆松下幸之助。【原文：Panasonic Holdings Corp. created an artificial intelligence clone of its late founder Konosuke Matsushita based on his writings, speeches, and over 3,000 voice recordings, the company announced Wednesday.】

item.title: 日本芯片股因美国有望放宽对华限制而攀升
item.description: 据报道，美国政府正在权衡对向中国销售芯片设备和人工智能存储器半导体实施比预期更宽松的限制，日本半导体相关公司的股票周四跳涨。【原文：Shares of Japanese semiconductor-related companies jumped Thursday after the US government was reported to be weighing lighter-than-expected restrictions on sales of chip equipment and AI memory semiconductors to China.】

item.title: 稳定的印度卢比抵御特朗普关税威胁引发的货币风暴
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 人工智能减少诈骗损失，加快澳大利亚顶级银行房屋贷款速度
item.description: 澳大利亚联邦银行（Commonwealth Bank of Australia）表示，人工智能生成工具将客户因诈骗造成的损失减少了一半。它还帮助将抵押贷款预批准流程缩短至 10 分钟。【原文：Commonwealth Bank of Australia said generative artificial intelligence tools cut customer losses from scams in half. It has also helped to shorten the process for mortgage pre-approvals to as little as 10 minutes.】

item.title: 国会特别会议将为上田提供引导市场利率的机会
item.description: 日本央行行长上田一夫（Kazuo Ueda）将有机会在市场对近期加息的押注不断升温之际引导与利率政策有关的预期。【原文：The start of an extraordinary diet session will likely give Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda an opportunity to steer expectations related to rate policy at a time when market bets on a near-term hike have been ramping higher.】

item.title: 美国准备对中国芯片实施限制，但与早先的提议相去甚远
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，拜登政府正在权衡进一步限制向中国销售半导体设备和人工智能存储芯片的措施，这将使美国打击中国政府科技野心的行动升级，但与此前考虑的一些更严格的措施相比，这些措施还不够。【原文：The Biden administration is weighing additional curbs on sales of semiconductor equipment and AI memory chips to China that would escalate the US crackdown on Beijing’s tech ambitions but stop short of some stricter measures previously considered, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 中国电动汽车热潮有可能将汽油需求推下悬崖
item.description: 从环绕北京故宫的古巷中的特斯拉充电桩，到西部沙漠中设有充电桩的孤独的高速公路休息站，中国交通运输电气化和汽油消亡的迹象随处可见。【原文：From Tesla chargers in the ancient alleys that surround the Forbidden City in Beijing to lonely highway rest stops with charging posts in the western deserts, signs of the electrification of China’s transport fleet — and the demise of gasoline — are everywhere.】

item.title: 加密货币支持者角逐美国监管机构首脑，比特币获得提振
item.description: 有迹象表明，对加密货币友好的候选人很可能会在唐纳德-特朗普的领导下制定美国的金融规则，比特币重新开始向 100,000 美元攀升。【原文：Bitcoin resumed a climb toward $100,000 on signs that crypto-friendly candidates will likely shape US financial rules under Donald Trump.】

item.title: 美国首家全天候证券交易所获美国证券交易委员会批准
item.description: 一家旨在全天候处理交易的初创证券交易所获得了美国监管机构的批准，可以每周五天、每天 23 小时运营。【原文：A startup stock exchange aiming to handle trades around the clock won a US watchdog’s approval to operate a venue 23 hours daily, five days a week.】

item.title: 特朗普就墨西哥谈判发表最新声明引发比索剧烈波动
item.description: 在当选总统唐纳德-特朗普表示他与墨西哥总统克劳迪娅-希恩鲍姆进行了卓有成效的会谈后，比索汇率走高，收窄了本周早些时候的一些跌幅。【原文：The peso advanced after President-elect Donald Trump said he had a very productive conversation with Mexico’s president Claudia Sheinbaum, paring some of the losses seen earlier in the week.】

item.title: 特朗普胜选加剧贸易风险，韩国央行意外降息
item.description: 韩国央行在上个月的政策中枢调整之后，接连发布了更为悲观的经济增长预测，周四又下调了基准利率，令投资者大吃一惊。【原文：The Bank of Korea surprised investors by cutting its benchmark interest rate Thursday after delivering gloomier growth forecasts in a back-to-back move following its policy pivot last month.】

item.title: 伊朗原油运输放缓，中国买家抢购未售石油
item.description: 中国的独立炼油厂抢购来自中东和非洲的石油桶，因为伊朗石油的供应量仍然较少，价格也比往常更高，部分原因是美国扩大了制裁范围。【原文：China’s independent refiners have snapped up barrels from across the Middle East and Africa as offers of Iranian oil remain scarcer and more expensive than usual, in part due to broadening US sanctions.】

item.title: 非上市股票交易的繁荣为印度带来财富和风险
item.description: 随着印度证券交易所的不断扩大，过去几年中造就了数十位亿万富翁，同时也出现了一个规模庞大、基本不受监管的非上市股票灰色市场。【原文：As India’s stock exchanges expand, minting dozens of billionaires over the past few years, a sprawling and largely unregulated gray market for unlisted shares has emerged.】

item.title: 如果特朗普颁布较温和的关税措施，亚洲债券将落后于新兴市场债券
item.description: 如果唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税政策最终比人们担心的要温和，亚洲新兴债券的价格将变得更加昂贵，使其吸引力低于全球同类债券。【原文：Emerging Asian bonds are turning more expensive, making them less attractive than their global peers if Donald Trump’s tariff policies turn out to be milder than feared.】

item.title: 中国新疆崛起为煤炭枢纽有损气候目标
item.description: 新疆西部地区正在成为中国煤炭生产的第四个枢纽，就在中国试图开始摆脱这种污染严重的燃料时，它创造了一个新的降价供应井。【原文：The western region of Xinjiang is emerging as a fourth hub for Chinese coal production, creating a new well of cut-price supply just as the country tries to start weaning itself off the heavily polluting fuel.】

item.title: 民进党官员表示日本央行加息不会破坏预算谈判
item.description: 日本首相石破茂的少数派政府需要一位反对党高级成员的支持，他表示，日本央行很可能不会突然改变政策，以至于破坏预算讨论。【原文：The Bank of Japan likely won’t change policy abruptly enough to derail budget discussions, according to a senior member of an opposition party whose support is needed by Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba’s minority government.】

item.title: 欧佩克+重要会议召开前，石油市场交投清淡，变动不大
item.description: 美国感恩节假期前，石油市场交投清淡，变化不大，市场焦点集中在本周末的欧佩克+会议上。【原文：Oil was little changed as trading thinned before the US Thanksgiving holiday, with the focus on this weekend’s OPEC+ meeting.】

item.title: 面对特朗普，墨西哥 2025 年的前景更加暗淡
item.description: 就在墨西哥总统克劳迪娅-希恩鲍姆试图平息人们对唐纳德-特朗普威胁征收 25% 关税的担忧之际，经济学家们却忧心忡忡地展望着，如果美国当选总统真的付诸实施，未来将面临的麻烦。【原文：Even as Mexico President Claudia Sheinbaum attempts to quell concerns over Donald Trump’s threat of 25% tariffs, economists are looking glumly at the trouble ahead should the US president-elect actually follow through.】

item.title: 澳大利亚中央银行改革在最后会谈中重启
item.description: 工党政府和左翼少数党绿党在最后一刻开始谈判，以重启陷入僵局的立法，此后，澳大利亚对储备银行进行彻底改革的计划（包括将现有董事会一分为二）可能会重新提上议事日程。【原文：Australia’s plans to overhaul the Reserve Bank, including splitting the current board in two, may be back on the agenda after the Labor government and minority left-wing Greens Party began last minute talks to revive the stalled legislation.】

item.title: Lombard Odier称购买中国刺激政策是 "痛苦的交易
item.description: 虽然中国的经济刺激政策给中国 10 万亿美元的股票市场带来了最初的欣喜，但对于 Lombard Odier 的亚洲投资总监来说，之后发生的事情却让他感到不安。【原文：While China’s stimulus blitz delivered initial euphoria to the nation’s $10 trillion stock market, for Lombard Odier’s Asia investment chief it’s what happened after that has him on edge.】

item.title: G1 称巴西将公布 120 亿美元的开支削减计划
item.description: 据巴西当地网站 G1 报道，巴西财政部长费尔南多-哈达德（Fernando Haddad）将公布一项寻求已久的计划，从公共开支中削减 700 亿雷亚尔（约合 118 亿美元），直至 2026 年。【原文：Brazil Finance Minister Fernando Haddad is set to unveil a long-sought plan to cut 70 billion reais ($11.8 billion) from public spending through 2026 as investors’ fiscal concerns sink assets from the currency to stocks, according to a report by local website G1.】

item.title: 新西兰填补职位减少表明失业率上升
item.description: 10 月份，新西兰的就业岗位连续第七个月减少，失业率上升的迹象更加明显。【原文：New Zealand filled jobs fell for a seventh straight month in October, adding to signs of rising unemployment.】

item.title: 美国债券收益率下降，日元因美元走强：市场综述
item.description: 在国债反弹对收益率和美元造成压力之后，日元走强削弱了周四的日本股票期货。美国股市在感恩节假期前下跌。【原文：A stronger yen weakened Japanese equity futures Thursday after a rally in Treasuries weighed on yields and the dollar. US stocks fell ahead of the Thanksgiving holiday.】

item.title: 克里希南将离开安德烈森，与马斯克商讨未来角色
item.description: 安德森-霍洛维茨公司（Andreessen Horowitz）的普通合伙人斯里拉姆-克里希南（Sriram Krishnan）即将离开这家风险投资公司，并已与埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）商讨加入其提高政府效率的工作。【原文：Andreessen Horowitz general partner Sriram Krishnan is leaving the venture capital firm, and has had discussions with Elon Musk about joining his efforts to improve government efficiency.】

item.title: 特朗普引发的比特币反弹对韩国小盘股来说是个坏消息
item.description: 自唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）最近赢得大选以来，比特币涨势迅猛，这给资本市场的一个偏远角落带来了压力：韩国的小盘股。【原文：Bitcoin’s breakneck rally since the recent election victory of Donald Trump is piling pressure on a far-flung corner of the capital markets: small cap stocks in South Korea.】

item.title: 墨西哥石油公司因供应商债务问题冻结与承包商的新合同
item.description: 墨西哥国家石油公司（Petroleos Mexicanos）正在冻结与服务供应商的新合同，因为该公司正努力偿还拖欠供应商的约 200 亿美元债务。【原文：Mexican state oil company Petroleos Mexicanos is putting a freeze on new contracts with service providers as the company works to pay off the roughly $20 billion it owes suppliers.】
